text: Bottle. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. Dark bronze. Soft haze. Thin, dense film of beige head, that sticks all the way. Nose has lots of rye spice. Notes of bourbon and chocolatey, vanilla infused oak. Bit of a jaffa cake thing going on. Taste is soft, orangey sweet. Gets spicy, peppery bitter. Bit of a citric twang. Soft and smooth, massaging mouthfeel. The finish is spicy and soft bitter. Missus is comparing this with Shameless Santa. Im inclined to agree. Lovely.
Bottle from the dregs run delivery. Thanks Craig! Pours hazy amber with a thin off-white head. Aromas of coconut, caramel. Taste has vanilla and more nuttiness, faint bourbon. Sweet finish.

Bottle at cgarvieuk tasting. 
Appearance - hazy amber red with a nice off white head. 
Nose - redcurrants and caramel. Light booze.
Taste - nuts and caramel. Generally praline.
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry sweet finish. 
Overall - good.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear amber, nose is coconut, toffee, vanilla, caramel, taste is sweet, chewy, orange, coconut, wood.
Bottle at home. . Dark brown... Small tan head... Soft sweet toffee fruit nose.. Juicy sweet toffee fruit... Light berries.. Lightest bourbon.. Dark chocolate roast... Dark fruits

Based on their Red Rye, this has a big toffee and fruit note thats created by the bourbon barrel. Rye spice is well balanced with the fruit sweetness. Aroma is also well balanced with spice, vanilla, and toffee. Only problem I had was bottle was not capped properly.

6th December 2015The Pigs Ear wrap up tasting at ChrisOs. Hazy deep red - amber beer, small cream colour head. Palate is light, semi dry and has decent fine carbonation. Thin sweetish malts, a tangy caramel - toffee and thin malt cream. Nice, if thin, bourbon. A little floralness. Light citric peel and marmalade. Touch of woody bitterness. Some mild and sweetish esters. Light dry finish. Dry but tasty.

Bottle big thanks to Leighton. It pours cloudy deep brown with a decent beige. The nose is soft, sweet, sticky, toffee, raw booze, bourbon, honeycomb, vanilla, banana split and wood. The taste is bitter-sweet, big boosty bourbon hit, oak, light charred notes, leather, tannins, vanilla, dark chocolate, cacao nibs and dried fruits with a dry finish. Medium - full body and average carbonation. Good depth and balance. Nice work.

75cl bottle split at Chrisos Xmas Tasting 2015, London. It pours a clean copper color with a minimal beige head. Aroma is sweet and malty with notes of chocolate vanilla and bourbon. Taste is sweet and lightly tangy with notes of chocolate and bourbon. Very well balanced. Medium bodied with creamy texture and good carbonation. Overall, very good and not over the top

Bottle shared at Moncada tap room. Very dark red, still, opaque, very large foamy tan head. Aroma is toffee, bourbon, red berries, alcohol and a little vegetal. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is vanilla, coconut, metallic woody notes with a fairly dry finish. Nice stuff.
Bottle shared by Leighton. Murky brownish color, small off-white head. Smell and taste malts, wood, bourbon, a lot of oak in there. Decent body, average carbonation.

Bottle shared with my beer brothers Cloin and Danny during the night of the release at the brewery. We beat the lines! Pours mostly clear reddish-brown with a lasting, creamy tan head. Fresh wood in the nose, toasty bread, dried berries, caramel. Medium sweet flavor with decent alcohol boost, some vanilla, more wood, toffee, dried fruits, figs. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Moderately warming on the finish with decent earthy bitterness, further caramel and light coconut, dried fruits, figs, berries, golden raisins. Good stuff overall. Might soften up novel with a bit more age.

Bottle split at the brewery tap room, 19/11/15.
Rich amber with a decent beige covering that retains well. 
Nose is laced in bourbon, coconut shavings, rich malt, spice, wooded notes, fruit loaf, light spice. 
Taste comprises sharp fruit, coconut, vanilla fudge, bourbon licks, spice, rich malt, toffee, light perfume. 
Medium + bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a rising level of alcohol.
Solid strong, well joined up with a good bourbon boost.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND
